action.action-desc: Mr. Arrington (for himself, Mr. Newhouse, Ms. Maloy, Mr. Moore of Utah, and Mr. Owens) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Natural Resources

form.official-title: To direct the Director of the Bureau of Land Management and the Chief of the United States Forest Service to conduct a study of onshore mineral values and the Director of the Bureau of Ocean Energy Management to conduct a study of offshore mineral values.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Abundant American Resources Act of 2025.

section.header: Onshore and offshore mineral value studies

subsection.text: Not later than three years after the date of the enactment of this section—

paragraph.text: the Director of the Bureau of Land Management, shall complete (including through a contract with a private entity) a study to determine the dollar value of liquid, gaseous, locatable, leasable, and salable minerals present in each covered onshore area under the jurisdiction of the Director; and

the Chief of the Forest Service, shall complete (including through a contract with a private entity) a study to determine the dollar value of liquid, gaseous, and locatable minerals present in each covered onshore area under the jurisdiction of the Chief.

subsection.text: Not later than three years after the date of the enactment of this section, the Director of the Bureau of Ocean Energy Management shall complete (including through a contract with a private entity) a study to determine the dollar value of liquid, gaseous, and locatable minerals present in each covered offshore area under the jurisdiction of the Director.
The studies required under subsections (a) and (b) shall—

subparagraph.text: any unit of the National Park System; and
any national monument designated as an area of critical environmental concern before January 1, 2000.

paragraph.text: the term area of critical environmental concern means an area that meets all of the criteria identified under section 1610.7–2(d) of title 43, Code of Federal Regulations;
the term co-managed area means an area that is under the jurisdiction of two or more Federal agencies;
the term covered onshore area means—

clause.text: that is not a marine national monument; and

subparagraph.text: an area of critical environmental concern; and
an area that has been withdrawn from—

clause.text: entry under the general mining laws; or
operation of the mineral leasing and mineral materials laws;

paragraph.text: the term covered offshore area means—

subparagraph.text: an offshore area that has been withdrawn from—

clause.text: entry under the general mining laws; or
operation of the mineral leasing and mineral materials laws; and

subparagraph.text: an offshore area that is otherwise designated as an area under moratorium;

paragraph.text: the term liquid minerals includes crude oil; and
the term gaseous minerals includes natural gas.
